item.description:
Jonathan Bates of Food Forest Farm and The Permaculture Plant Nursery returns to Portland for one day only to help us on our way into the world of propagating plants AND lead us through a hands-on demonstration of planting an Edible Forest Garden using many of the plants we'll be discussing.  Plus:  Pick-up your pre-ordered plants from Food Forest Farm that Jonathan will bring (delivery no charge). 

Why learn to propagate your own plants?

  • Save money! Learn to use various methods that are free or inexpensive to populate your landscape with productive, multi-function plantings.
  • Produce more food! Most of the plantings we'll talk about are food-producing among other things.
  • Become a resource in your community for plants and plant materials - very important for maintaining biological diversity and plant genetics being crowded out by consolidation of plant varieties.
  • Become a neighborhood permaculture plant nursery!  We need these up and down the state to assist our friends and neighbors in the creation of edible perennial ecosystems that have the ability to feed humans and non-humans alike, indefinitely.  Jonathan can speak to this topic better than almost anyone in the Northeast!

10:00  Opening/Coffee/Tea/Introductions

10:15  Introduction to Propagation and Various Techniques

11:00  Tools of the trade and examples of plants that have been propagated

12:00  Demonstration/Practice if time allows

12:30  Closing and Discussion of Resources for further practice/study

POTLUCK LUNCH (bring a dish to share and your own potluck kit)

1:30  Introducing Forest Garden Concept (Like a forest, not "in" a forest:)

2:00 - 3:30  Planting a demonstration forest garden (Demo and hands-on) with permaculture plants in designed polycultures

3:45-ish Closing + Pickup Pre-Ordered Plants

---------------------------------------

More about Jonathan:

Jonathan runs Food Forest Farm Permaculture Nursery, a source for useful, edible, hard to find plants and seeds. He’s been studying, creating and working with rural and urban gardens in the Connecticut River Valley for the last ten years, and is a co-designer and inhabitant of an edible forest garden in Holyoke, MA.

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: Propagating Your Own Permaculture Plants & Planting a Forest Garden
